observations.content: The system uses a microservices architecture with separate components for different services.
The system uses Graphology and LevelDB for knowledge storage at .data/knowledge-graph.
The system provides a command-line interface using the vkb command for visualization and MCP tools for knowledge operations.
The system uses the GraphDatabaseService component to provide graph database services.
The system uses the graph-sync command to synchronize data between the graph database and JSON exports.
The system stores knowledge exports at .data/knowledge-export, which are auto-synced from the graph database.
The system uses the VkbApiClient component to interact with the knowledge base.
The system uses the GraphKnowledgeExporter component to export knowledge from the graph database.
The system uses the coding command to perform coding-related operations.
The system auto-syncs JSON exports from the GraphDB to .data/knowledge-export.
The system uses the PersistenceAgent component to persist knowledge in the graph database.
Detailed insight document available at: knowledge-management/insights/KnowledgePersistencePattern.md
Coding is implemented across: src/knowledge-management, lib/ukb-unified, integrations/mcp-server-semantic-analysis/src
Current codebase uses GraphDatabaseService with Graphology + LevelDB storage at .data/knowledge-graph, with auto-synced JSON exports to .data/knowledge-export directory
Recent parallel workers implementation for batch mode semantic analysis suggests scalable processing patterns suitable for network-aware operations
Available commands include 'vkb' for visualization, 'coding' for development operations, and 'graph-sync' for knowledge synchronization between storage layers
Incremental content constraints now only apply to edit/write operations, reducing unnecessary processing overhead for network-dependent installations
Knowledge persistence must utilize GraphDatabaseAdapter and PersistenceAgent components, avoiding the removed shared-memory.json approach
Detailed insight document available at: knowledge-management/insights/NetworkAwareInstallationPattern.md
MCPMemoryLoggingIntegrationPattern is implemented across: src/knowledge-management, lib/ukb-unified, integrations/mcp-server-semantic-analysis/src
Core components: GraphDatabaseService, GraphKnowledgeExporter, GraphDatabaseAdapter
shared-memory.json has been REMOVED from the codebase
Knowledge storage uses Graphology + LevelDB at .data/knowledge-graph
JSON exports are at .data/knowledge-export (auto-synced from GraphDB)
Detailed insight document available at: knowledge-management/insights/MCPMemoryLoggingIntegrationPattern.md
Current architecture uses Graphology + LevelDB at .data/knowledge-graph with auto-sync to JSON exports at .data/knowledge-export, managed by GraphDatabaseService and GraphDatabaseAdapter components
Knowledge operations are accessed through vkb command for visualization and graph-sync for synchronization, with VkbApiClient handling API communications
Recent commits show active development on constraint handling and semantic analysis integration, with shared-memory.json removal indicating architectural migration
PersistenceAgent and GraphKnowledgeExporter provide data validation and export capabilities for the knowledge graph stored in .data directories
MCP server semantic analysis integration at integrations/mcp-server-semantic-analysis/src enables automated knowledge extraction and classification
Detailed insight document available at: knowledge-management/insights/VSCodeExtensionBridgePattern.md

shared-memory.json has been REMOVED from the codebase
Knowledge storage uses Graphology + LevelDB at .data/knowledge-graph
JSON exports are at .data/knowledge-export (auto-synced from GraphDB)
Workflow is triggered via MCP tools (execute_workflow) or automatic incremental analysis
CodingWorkflow is part of the semantic analysis and knowledge management infrastructure
CodingWorkflow workflow details pending full codebase analysis
Detailed insight document available at: knowledge-management/insights/CodingWorkflow.md

The current architecture uses a graph database (Graphology + LevelDB) stored at .data/knowledge-graph, with auto-synced JSON exports at .data/knowledge-export. The system interacts with external services through API clients (VkbApiClient) and MCP tools.

The GraphDatabaseService, GraphKnowledgeExporter, and PersistenceAgent components work together to manage knowledge storage and exports. The vkb command is used for visualization, while MCP tools are used for knowledge operations.
Detailed insight document available at: knowledge-management/insights/UkbCli.md

The current architecture uses a graph database (Graphology + LevelDB) for knowledge storage, with a separate directory (.data/knowledge-export) for JSON exports, and relies on commands (vkb, coding, graph-sync) for data manipulation and synchronization.

The GraphDatabaseService and PersistenceAgent components interact with the graph database, while the VkbApiClient manages client interactions with the knowledge graph, and the GraphKnowledgeExporter is responsible for exporting data to the .data/knowledge-export directory.
Detailed insight document available at: knowledge-management/insights/VkbCli.md

The system uses a microservices-based architecture, with components such as GraphDatabaseService and VkbApiClient, to manage knowledge storage and export.
The GraphDatabaseService component is used to interact with the knowledge graph stored in .data/knowledge-graph.
The system uses JSON exports at .data/knowledge-export, which are auto-synced from the GraphDB, to provide a data-driven development approach.
The system uses parallel workers for batch mode semantic analysis, as seen in the recent Git activity, to improve performance.
The use of specific commands, such as vkb and graph-sync, provides a clear and organized way to manage knowledge operations and visualization.
Detailed insight document available at: knowledge-management/insights/ApiPattern.md
ArchitecturalEvolutionPattern is implemented across: src/knowledge-management, lib/ukb-unified, integrations/mcp-server-semantic-analysis/src
shared-memory.json has been REMOVED from the codebase
Knowledge storage uses Graphology + LevelDB at .data/knowledge-graph
JSON exports are at .data/knowledge-export (auto-synced from GraphDB)
Pattern extracted from codebase analysis and stored as reusable knowledge entity
Detailed insight document available at: knowledge-management/insights/ArchitecturalEvolutionPattern.md
The system utilizes a microservices-based architecture, with components like GraphDatabaseService and PersistenceAgent, to promote scalability and flexibility.
The GraphDatabaseService uses Graphology + LevelDB for knowledge storage, which provides a robust data management system.
The system employs an event-driven approach, with features like parallel workers for batch mode semantic analysis, to enhance system responsiveness and fault tolerance.
The removal of shared-memory.json might introduce data consistency issues, and proper access control should be implemented for the VkbApiClient and data storage.
The use of the Decorator Pattern allows for added behavior to objects without modifying their structure, promoting flexibility and maintainability.
Detailed insight document available at: knowledge-management/insights/DecoratorPattern.md
The SemanticAnalysisAgentSystemImplementation uses a graph database with Graphology + LevelDB at .data/knowledge-graph for primary storage.
The system provides CLI access via the vkb command for visualization and MCP tools for knowledge operations.
The system auto-syncs JSON exports at .data/knowledge-export, which can be accessed using the vkb command.
The system uses the GraphDatabaseService, GraphKnowledgeExporter, and GraphDatabaseAdapter components to manage data storage and retrieval.
Detailed insight document available at: knowledge-management/insights/SemanticAnalysisAgentSystemImplementation.md
